name: Interior architect's website
description: As part of an exercise to develop the frontend of a website using HTML, JS, and CSS without any library or framework, I chose to structure it with a pure JS MVC architecture to build a client-rendered one-page site. Note that the backend was not developed by me.

name: Kasa real estate agency website
description: The task was to develop the website’s frontend based on a provided mockup using React. In addition, I implemented centralized error handling and separated content management to make the project ready for potential translation.

name: Backend of a book rating website
description: For this project, we were asked to develop the backend of a book rating website using Node.js, Express, and a MongoDB database. I focused on bringing it close to a production-ready state, with a modular structure and attention to security. I also implemented error monitoring through a logging system. Additionally, to enhance my learning, I developed an alternative version on a separate Git branch using PostgreSQL and Prisma.
